title: Kennen Damage numbers on PBE
body:
First off, I don't care that you are changing him but the fact is that your numbers are way off base.

PBE

"Slicing Malestrom (R) few changes - damage is similar for a full duration R but upfront damage nerfed significantly. 
Damage lowered to 40/75/110 from 80/145/210
AP Ratio lowered to 20% from 40%
[new effect] "Successive maelstrom hits against the same enemy deal an additional 10% damage for each hit they've already suffered from this storm."
[removed] "Each time an enemy is struck, further hits deal 25% less damage (minimum of 50% damage)."




-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Damage is similiar to a full duration.  I'm not sure if that is surrender @ 20 saying that or yourselves but that has never been farther from the truth and if it's someone from riot being serious, then they should be demoted or kicked off the team as they shouldn't work on balance since zero math skills.  Even if it wasn't, unless you were looking to not only cut down upfront damage but cut his biggest asset by 1/3rd in damage, the numbers have to change.  Take for example 10

Live numbers, 10, 7.5, 5 = 22.5.
PBE numbers:  5, 5.5, 6.05 = 16.55  
Basically only 66% damage vs what is on live.   If you want it to be similiar to live, damage increase needs to be ~45% for numbers of 5, 7.25, ~10.5 for 22.75 scaling up per hit vs 22.5 scaling down per hit.


> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=As3KE65P,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-12-10T12:09:13.536+0000)
>
> Kennen's ult hits 6 times, not 3. Using your example of 10 and 5 damage that means you'd want to compare:
> 
> * 10, 7.5, 5.0, 5.0, 5.0, 5.0 = 37.5
> 
> And
> 
> * 5.0, 5.5, 6.0, 6.5, 7.0, 7.5 = 37.5
> 
> So same damage, but back loaded instead of front loaded. That is a nerf still though certainly (burstier damage is more powerful), but not as large a one as you'd identified. We're testing this change because we don't believe Kennen should be as bursty as he is at present, given the other tools he brings.


For some reason I thought it being only 3 hits.  The tool tip kind of misleads me because of the storm application saying up to 3 times.  I'm the dummy here because then yes, for 6 times the math does pan out.    I don't have a problem with changing the upfront burst and even I play as one of my more main champions (which is sad me thinking it's only 3 hits lol)  Having the stuns and his E ability should allow him to get the damage out in most situations regardless, just might take longer to kill.    With the tool tip and the sound effects from storm application (and lack thereof on last 3 hits and with the damage reduction on last hits) kind of hard to tell it did damage beyond 3.

on the topic of kennen (kinda; its related).

can you please make a statement, why you kept rylais ability to permaslow enemy champions with multi hit abilities? what you guys did was nerf every single thing about the item that wasnt the problem, and kept the one thing that made it broken.

im not entirely sure why you changed your stance on permaslows being toxic, or if youre fully aware, what the item actually does to melee champions without multiple gapclosers.

dps ap effects like zyras plants, malzahars voidlings and e, or heimer turrets, morganas w ... straight up disable slow melee champions. it becomes impossible to act or move in fights. you cant even retreat. not to mention trying to get anywhere to fight back, because youre under a barrage of cnstant slows. which makes it easier to get hit by more slows and other cc abilities.

most of these abilities either passively slow you without the rylais user even having to aim at you, or in case of malzahars e just require him to click on you from a distance. against champions mind you, who are aleady easier to hit from the start. there is no way to play around these effects.

if youre caught by a rylais permaslow on a slow melee champion, you can literally afk and watch yourself die, as there is no point in struggling. if youre lucky you can flash out of range, but that doesnt solve the problem that you cant participate in fights against these guys. this isnt exaggeration, its exactly what happens against teams with 1 or more reliable rylais permaslows.

you removed the ability to cleanse debuff effects like zeds ult with qss and reworked stealth (removed pink wards), because you didnt want single items invalidate entire champion abilities.

so why do you think its acceptable, that an item invalidates entire champions?
its only 20% now. get boots of swiftness. its a big buff already to champions like juggernauts, that the item was nerfed so heavily

> its only 20% now. get boots of swiftness. its a big buff already to champions like juggernauts, that the item was nerfed so heavily

it was 20% for multi hit abilities before.

the only thing the "nerf" did was to allow abusers to pick it up faster, since its also massively cheaper. it extended the use from mages to supports.

the slow that was nerfed was 40% for aoe abilities which got nerfed to 20%. nobody cares about a lux e slowing by 40% for 1 second every 10 seconds. or annies initial tibbers burst slowing you when it overlaps with her stun.

the problem with the item is that dot mage use it to nail slow melee champions to the ground for 20 seconds and longer with slow spams, while the only thing you can do is watch yourself die as you struggle to get out of range or into range to fight back. that part of the item didnt get touched.

rylais against slow melee champions is about as fair as an on-hit item that silences you for 1 second on auto attacks would be against mages. its an item that targets certain champions and prevents them from doing anything at all.

it takes 0 fucking efford to use to entirely disable such a champion with it.

I don't think you understand that the 20% effect was only for DoTs like Singed's poison or Malzahar's E.

For consistent but individual hits, like Malzahar's voidlings, Zyra's plants, Azir, Taliyah, Cassiopeia, Heimer, etc etc, the effect is significantly nerfed.

Lux never even bought rylais.

Again I recommend buying boots of swiftness when against champions like those who still buy rylais, or vs ashe.

nope. i think you misunderstand. this was the old effect for rylais with the changes.

> - Single Target Slow increased to 40% from 35%
> - Area of Effect Slow (instant) increased to 40% from 15% 
> - Damage over time or Multi-hit Slow increased to 20% for 1 second from 15% for 1.5 seconds 
> - Summoned minions (e.g. Mordekaiser's Children of the Grave, Annie Annie's Summon- Tibbers) now slow on-hit 20% for 1 second

what the "nerf" did was

> - Slow changed to 20% for 1 second **in all cases.** 

the only part that was affected was its single target slows (viktor q), and instant area of effect damage slows (like lux e).

yes, youre right. champions like lux didnt abuse the item. thats why that change has no real effect and isnt actually a nerf.

so it literally does not make a difference for permaslows. meddler even said that they wanted the item to stay the same for malzahar, zyra etc.

for whatever fucking reason. there has still not been an explanation to WHY they find effordless permaslows on these champions desirable, when they were deemed toxic on melee champions.

by the way, talyiahs q is a multi hit ability. every ability that has is activated once and then deals multiple instances of damage is. so no difference for her q slow. im not sure, if it slowed for 40% on the first hit of her q, but subsequent hits should have only slowed by 20% even before the change.

tibbers burn should still permaslow you for 20% just like before. the item is just as toxic as ever.

I'm almost certain that zyras plants slowed by 40% on hits at the very least.

You can also kill malz minions easily now.

Overall this patch was a huge buff to juggernauts seems ridiculous you'd still be unsatisfied.

rylais passive itself should not exist and should be reverted to pre 5.13. like, fuck the stats. give it the stats back for all i care. they werent the items issues. it was exactly the part of the slow passive that they kept that is wrong with the item.

>  we don't believe Kennen should be as bursty as he is at present, given the other tools he brings.

Whoever first said that deserves a raise.

This I still think will cause too big of a negative effect to kennen. Take the other champs with ults that have wide AoE damage/effect centered around the champ, they are all solidly in the category of tanks (rammus, galio, nunu, amumu). Kennen is in the category of a squishy and needs to have his ult have a lot of front loaded damage since there is already the counterplay of blow him up compared to the already shared counterplay of stay out of the danger zone that kennen shares with the tanks that have similar style ults, and in fact kennen has more counterplay than them.

If you really wanted to do a ramp up effect I think that you will have to actually tone back the degree of the base+ratio nerf from the current pbe 50% nerf. Considering the higher level of danger kennen is in, and the fact of rylai's nerf which is seeming to be ignored by riot, I think it would be healthier to change the base+ratio into a 40% nerf and increase the per tick scaling to 15%, to there is proper reward for keeping on top of people for the full cast of the ult and better equalizes his effect from the rylai's nerf without buffing his entire kit.

Question: was Kennen really performing well enough to justify such a large nerf? I would have thought Protobelt, Hourglass, and Abyssal all being nerfed would have been sufficient.
I rarely see Kennen anymore and when I do, he's not exactly dominating.

Edit on main:

For some reason I thought it being only 3 hits. The tool tip kind of misleads me because of the storm application saying up to 3 times. I'm the dummy here because then yes, for 6 times the math does pan out. With the tool tip and the sound effects from storm application (and lack thereof on last 3 hits and with the damage reduction on last hits) kind of hard to tell it did damage beyond 3.  I don't have a problem with changing the upfront burst and even I play as one of my more main champions (which is sad me thinking it's only 3 hits lol). Having the stuns and his E ability should allow him to get the damage out in most situations regardless, just might take longer to kill.  Not a bad change as it lengthens kill time while still allowing his damage to get out in most situations and does the job of a nerf as it's more counterable.

TBH i'm still confused as to when kennen lost the duration upgrade per rank from 3 to 4 at rank 2 to 5 at rank 3.

His R is 90% the reason he is even picked. His Q is single target with below average damage, W also below average, and his E is not the most reliable form of damage. Compared to plenty of other mages they bring significantly more tools of practical use that he does not. His waveclear is pretty bad till he gets a high amount of AP vs a lot of popular picks that do it with far less effort. If he is being nerfed cause of his use in top lane that is 100% a issue with ranged characters in general going up there which you people have failed to respond to adequately and no amount of number changes will ever fix that problem as long as ranged characters with any form of disengage exist.

Coming into season 7 it's pretty clear after all these years that you people feel his ult is overall not toxic and fair enough for the risk he has to put himself in (Would of just been truly gutted long before then right?). So what's the complaint right now? My complaint is that he isn't being rewarded with this new change in comparison to the old for hitting 6 bolts. His damage overall on the first 5 is less with this change then what it currently is and if he hits 6 (Which is very impractical in real use) the damage just merely ties.
Lets forget the fact that you still can E/Flash in and Zhonya forcing an entire team to get away or get deleted.
TBH he deserves to have his damage cut that much. Doesn't even matter if their math is off.
